Reviews.Title: Olympus FE-350
Reviews.Author: Scott E. Johnson "scootercrunch"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, easy to thrown in a pocket and take with you.  The wide angle lens really comes in handy; the main reason that I choose this camera.  The colors really seem to pop in the pictures that I have taken so far, very easy to learn and use camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoor pictures; disappointing for indoor ones
Reviews.Author: Shevi "FantasyWeaver"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the wide-angle lens, Olympus has a good reputation, and I liked the price.The wide-angle lens is great. It lets you fit more into a shot.Pictures taken indoors are surprisingly inferior. I know the product description mentions picture stabalization, but I didn't see any sign of it. What I did see was that it's almost impossible to take a good picture indoors in regular indoor lighting conditions. I'm not talking about a few candles, but really normal indoor lighting with a bit of indirect sunlight and a lamp switched on. Without the flash, images come out blurry; and with the flash, items in the foreground are too bright while the background is too dark. This for me was a huge disappointment.I have no complaints, however, about the pictures this camera takes outdoors. They are stunning, rivaling the ones I used to take with my old SLR, pictures I used to sell to newspapers. They're crisp, and their colors are sharp. This is a great camera for outdoor shots.The large viewing screen is very nice and makes it easy to see what your picture will look like before you snap it.The buttons are a bit difficult to figure out, not the worst I've seen, but also far from the best. I don't know why, but I also keep finding my camera has switched itself back to automatic settings after I've changed them to turn the flash off. If I could, I would reset the settings so the flash only turned on when I wanted to use it. Unfortunately, that doesn't seem to be an option.All in all, this is a good camera for the price, with a few drawbacks.There's one more thing I would like to mention: I highly recommend getting the 2GB Olympus XD card with this camera. It's expensive, but it holds 1,000 high quality 8MP pictures. The carrying case is nice and cushiony, but it's really tiny, basically a camera version of a cloth eye-glasses case. You can do without that, but you can't do without the XD card. The camera can't hold more than ten or so pictures without it.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Barkley
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for use at our plant.  Takes excellent pictures, very clear, color fabulous, ease of use.  Highly recommdend.  Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy Camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Rifman
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year now, and it's working without any problems.  The battery life is remarkable, and the battery lasts for approximately 2 days (with moderate usage of taking and then showing images to all involved).The only downside -- It is nearly impossible to take a decent picture with this camera (without a tripod) in poor lighting conditions.  The stabilization feature does NOT help with this problem.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, average software
Reviews.Author: Redjr
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus FE-350 because I needed a wider lense than the typical point-and-shoot camera. I was not disappointed. The FE-350 is easy to use and provides great pictures.I gave the camera a rating of four stars because I need to be able to create panoramas and the Olympus Master software provided with the camera doesn't do that great of a job stitching photos together. I have been getting better results from other photo software using the same pictures. So,the problem isn't all in the pictures I have been taking.However, the camera yields excellent results in the photos and is easy to use. The camera is a steal for the price.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Rocks!
Reviews.Author: Ronald W. Jenkins "RonJ"
Reviews.Content: Weighs next to nothing even with battery in, compact, fits easily in your pocket.  Perfect for that small camera you want handy without hauling a bigger camera.  Sweet liitle zoom feature not typically on cameras of this size. Nice Wide angle feature.Only negative and its not really an issue but it uses a special Lithium battery that is included with the camera. So you can not just pop in a new set of AA/AAA.  Got a spare for $12.00 on Amazon so that is covered.

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE 350
Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for my old camera.  I guess I didn't read the description close enough.  There isn't a view finder. Also, it  seems like very few of my pictures turn out as good as my older camera.  I  have a problem with the shade of the pictures having alot of yellow tones in them.  I wish I had purchased something else.

Reviews.Title: great user friendly camera
Reviews.Author: Maria Thibault "masha thibault"
Reviews.Content: just got this camera. even though it does not produce the most spectacular photos, it is very user friendly and will help you to get the best with what you got. my technologically challenged friend managed to figure it out on his own. it has in-camera guide ("shooting through the glass"--man, that always gets me), and options are so easy to control. rechargable battery, big LCD screen. software is pretty average, but the camera is a great value for hundred bucks. perfect size too, not so small that it would make your hands shake, just to hold it. beware of a different memory format(xD), and be prepared to spend extra money for it(2G-$22).

Reviews.Title: you need a picture card!
Reviews.Author: Ms Picture-Taker
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera just recently so not giving a 'long-time user' review; I like the camera just fine so far but be aware that the picture card IS NOT INCLUDED.  I know it says so in the description, but that's just 2 words in a whole page of information, and why in heaven's name is it not included?  My last olympus camera included a picture card, and since the camera is virtually useless without a card then it makes no sense to not include it.  I found that really annoying as I had to go back and place another order for the card.  In spite of all this, I like the camera so far...

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: T. Zaborowski
Reviews.Content: This is a good little camera and seems pretty durable.  The picture quality is justso so, but the battery life is fantastic.  If you take the time to read the manual, it can do loads of stuff.  I, do not read the manual.  Great for an inexpensive camera. I think a little better than the Koday Easy Share.

Reviews.Title: Good pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: Bron "Bron"
Reviews.Content: Pros -- Good sharp lens with nice range from wide (28mm) to short telephoto (112mm)  -- Excellent color in good lighting  -- Good image quality overall, good color, sharp, good detail  -- Easy to use  -- Nice 3 inch LCD screen  -- Very compact, solid build, pocket size  -- Video (640x480) features are basic, but can use zoom if you turn sound off  -- Can add 4 secs of sound (e.g. a memo) to images when shooting or afterward in camera  -- Interesting "guide" feature built-in for novice photographersCons -- Uses more expensive xD cards (but you'll only need 1 or 2 ever, probably, 1 or 2 GB size)  -- Not so great for low light situations --but flash works fairly well  -- Auto WB indoors, sometimes need to set manually in my experience (e.g. "Incandescent")  -- Max ISO of 640 and some noise evident at higher ISO's (true for nearly all compact cameras)I bought this camera used for $50 (with a big scratch on the front, but works fine) and at that price I am very pleased with it.  It is a casual point and shoot model with basic features.  Image quality is average to very good, depending on the situation.  In general, I find I get good pics most of the time.  Taking a little time to "learn the camera" will definitely improve your results.  The menu is simple and easy to use. It even has a "guide" section where you can flip through your image needs (e.g. shooting into strong backlight) and it will select the correct settings, as well as the usual "scene" modes.  A nice touch.  Has a "panorama" assist mode. Has some internal editing features (e.g. crop). 8 megapixels is plenty for most things, including prints up to 16x20 inches maybe even a bit larger. The Jpegs are good quality.It has a very nice and sharp lens with a range from 28mm-112mm (35mm equiv) making it great for group shots to portraits.  The 4x zoom works reasonably well and 4x is a decent range of coverage for a compact P&S.;  The camera is very simple to pick up and shoot with and the compact size makes this a great pocket camera.  The LCD screen is 3" which is large and the quality is good.  The flash is fairly strong for a compact. As with all compacts, it can be a bit harsh sometimes, but it did reasonably well.The build quality is very good with a metal frame and plastic panels, it feels solid.  Buttons and controls work well and I find the camera very easy to use and intuitive.  I have not even looked at the PDF manual yet and have had no problems.  The camera has a pretty good feature set, the only thing really missing is full manual controls, auto exposure bracketing, and a few other advanced things that most users will never miss.  Operation is fairly quick, certainly par for this class.Color is good in most of the shots I've taken so far, especially outdoors in good light where the color is accurate and not overly vivid.  Video on this camera is std def (640x480) but decent and if you turn off the sound recording, you can use the zoom while shooting video which was novel when this camera was introduced.  Indoors I sometimes had to set the WB (white balance) manually for best results. True for many cameras of this type.This camera is now a couple of years old (came out in early 2008) and there are newer models available, but it is a solid camera, takes good pics, and is very easy to use.  If you can find it on sale at a good price, it might still be a good value.  I am very happy with mine.  I will try to post some sample shots in 'customer images' if I get time.Summary: A great pocket camera that you can carry with you and quickly pull out to take some "on the spot" shots knowing that you will get good results, especially if you take the time to learn the camera.

Reviews.Title: Only Lasted a Year
Reviews.Author: Yogi Boo Boo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera almost exactly a year ago.  I work in real estate, and take a TON of pictures - I wanted something without a view finder, that would take good pictures with little lag time between shots and had the wide angle feature.  Not a lot of bells and whistles - no video or anything like that.  The picture quality both indoors and out left something to be desired - I agree with another review who said a lot of inside pics have yellow tones. This being said I was usually able to tweak the picture quality with Picture Manager to an acceptable level.  I didn't use the software that came with the camera so I can't comment on that.  The battery life is not great - I bought two extra batteries, and on a typical property inspection I will use all three batteries.  So, a year later the zoom button is not working consistently.  It gets stuck and then starts zooming in and out crazily.  So - here I am again looking for another camera a year later. I gave this three stars because overall it was adequate/average.  I wouldn't buy it again - but for my purposes I should have purchased something that was more of a workhorse than this I guess.

Reviews.Title: lemon
Reviews.Author: Melanie Thomas
Reviews.Content: bought this for my mother in law who is in her 60's...she took it on vacation...after two weeks it stopped working, but she won't send it in to have it looked at, just bought a new one.  She was not happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Bad Zooming Lens
Reviews.Author: M. Griffin
Reviews.Content: Purchased two for Christmas.  One failed two months later.  Lens would zoom in and out repeatedly, then camera would power down with the lens in the extended position.  Returned to Olympus but they wouldn't repair under warranty.  Maybe a 5x optical zoom for less than $200 is questionable.  This model has quality issues.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded My Expectations
Reviews.Author: JAK
Reviews.Content: I have delayed and delayed in purchasing a digital camera and finally settled on the Oluympus FE-350 after reading other Amazon reviews.  I have used others' digital cameras in the past and didn't like the slow flash/shutter response and found the small view-finders difficult to use.I have absolutely loved this camera!!  I don't find any issue with the flash/shutter speed being delayed and like the large view-finder.  I've used the camera to take pictures of flowers and birds -- the results are very detailed pictures with amazing clarity.  The camera is especially good in bright daylight and takes adequate pictures in darker settings.The Olympus software is easy to use, allowing for some creativity beyond just the normal download. Overall I would highly recommend this camera to anyone wanting a light-weight all-around camera.

Reviews.Title: Olumpus FE-350 8 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Randy Butler "splatshot"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera with lots of features.To get the correct lighting in most instances, you must select the scene feature which is very nice. Many times when I use this camera under low light conditions I select a scene for low light and the images come out very clear. When using the automatic feature the image may be unclear if you do not use this feature. Overall, this is a great value and good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and a great price!
Reviews.Author: L. Funakoshi
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, easy to use and I got it for a great price and free shipping!I bought it for my 13 year old daughter and she loves it and I don't worry about it too much because the price was so reasonable.The only thing is that it takes a specific storage disc and I couldn't use the one that I had bought for it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Righetti "my kid's mom"
Reviews.Content: Needed a small camera to carry with me in my purse or on horseback.  This one fits the bill!  Many options, easy to use, produces very nice pictures. Takes good pics in the kid's school or outside on the trail.  Recommend it for those wanting an inexpensive camera- this IS it!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Doesn't Stand Behind This Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Mark Harrington
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip and it worked well.  I purchased it in June, 2009 and used it three times until June, 2010.  When I took it out to get ready for a trip next month, it no longer worked.  I purchased it from Amazon, not another retailer.  Amazon told me that there was nothing they could do to help me!!!! I've been a very loyal customer for years and am EXTREMELY disappointed in both the product and Amazon's customer service.WARNING - Do NOT buy a camera from Amazon.  They are very glad to take your money, but evidently they think that a few weeks of use are adequate when one purchases a camera.  Shop at your local reatailer.  Buyer Beware!!

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
4x wide-angle optical zoom; Face detection technology
3-inch LCD screen
Includes Olympus Master 2 software
Stores images on xD Picture Cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-350 8MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Zoom (Silver)
